Description: Sherd of East Greek pottery plastic vessel; moulded head of hare attached to the join of a strap handle to the body of vessel; black glazed, save for underside of handle, with added red band at join with body and white dots on head of hare.
Curator's comments: The piece is best taken upright, with the handle arching high, and the mouth being closed; if taken as a horizontal handle, the hollow on the inside would be most unusual, and the walls very thin with respect to the heaviness of the handle. Illegible pencil mark. possibly ending with 7 or phi?
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.623)
